page.title: 07Education
page.content: {OLD SCHOOL It was built in 1854,on land provided by Lord Scarsdale.In 1900 the school had three teachers and 95 children. On the wall at the side is a plaque which reads "Feed my lambs."It closed as a school in February 1975 when the 47 children and three teachers moved to new premises.It is now used as the Playschool. {FRISBY C.E.(Controlled) SCHOOL It was opened in February 1975 by the Right Reverend Lord Bishop of Leicester, Dr.Ronald R.Williams.It is an open-plan building with one mobile classroom.Children come from Frisby, Hoby, Rotherby and Brooksby.In 1985 there are 85 children and 4 teachers. There is an active P.T.A. {FRISBY PLAYSCHOOL For children aged 3 to 5;run by Mrs. Smedley and helpers. 30 on roll.
